summary: In the wake of the Justice Department's antitrust lawsuit against Google, traders Mark Tepper and Matt Maley discuss the impact on Alphabet stock.
headline: Google under fire: What the DOJ's lawsuit means for Alphabet

summary: Amazon has ramped up curbside pickup at Whole Foods stores during the pandemic, amid a broader shift to online grocery shopping.
headline: Amazon launches one-hour grocery pickup at all U.S. Whole Foods stores

summary: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rishi Sunak cut a planned spending review from three years to one due to “unprecedented uncertainty,” dealing a blow to Boris Johnson’s plans to map out his priorities for a post-pandemic world.
headline: U.K. Curtails Spending Review in Fresh Blow to Boris Johnson

summary: TikTok has pledged to do more to tackle hateful content and behavior on its platform following reports that it has a Nazi problem and a White supremacy problem.
headline: TikTok says it plans to do more to tackle hateful content after reports it has a 'Nazi problem'
ATM fees didn't increase in 2020 for the first time in 15 years—here's why
summary: For the first time since 2004, the average out-of-network ATM fee fell in 2020. But other types of banking fees are still rising.

headline: Amazon employees can work remotely through June 2021
summary: Amazon follows in the footsteps of several tech companies that have extended their work from home policies until at least early 2021.

headline: Black Entrepreneurs Day shows 'people want to make a difference,' FUBU CEO Daymond John says
summary: FUBU CEO Daymond John illustrated what the public can expect to see when he hosts Black Entrepreneurs Day on Oct. 24.

headline: Jim Cramer: Three solar stocks to play on a Biden presidential election victory
summary: "The Democrats are eager to throw money at solar," the "Mad Money" host said," "which is why the stocks are running."
Netflix's Ted Sarandos is feeling confident that the company's slate of films and television shows planned for release in 2021 will find a place on the streaming service next year.
headline: Most of Netflix's 2021 slate of TV and film won't be hindered by coronavirus
A Democratic wave could make things much easier for the marijuana industry, Jim Cramer says
summary: "Just remember, stick to the picks and shovels plays or the vertically integrated operators that are actually profitable," the "Mad Money" host advised investors.

headline: The money race between Trump and Biden heats up with two weeks left: CNBC After Hours
summary: CNBC.com's MacKenzie Sigalos brings you the day's top business news headlines. On today's show, CNBC.com's Brian Schwartz breaks down the big fundraising haul from Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden and what it means for the presidential race with exactly two weeks until Election Day.
"I'm thinking about the stock and making money in the stock market. Ultimately, to do that, you have to evolve the business," Loup Ventures' Gene Munster told CNBC.
headline: Netflix needs to evolve for the stock to continue its stellar run, says Gene Munster

summary: A NASA spacecraft on Tuesday touched the surface of the asteroid Bennu, in a mission that aims to return rocky pieces for examination.
headline: NASA spacecraft OSIRIS-REx touches the asteroid Bennu in historic attempt to return samples
Stock futures rise as stimulus talks continue, Netflix shares fall after earnings miss
summary: Stock futures rose in overnight trading after lawmakers said stimulus talks will continue.
The World Economic Forum stressed the need for "reskilling" and "upskilling" to prepare people for the future of work.
headline: WEF says machines will create more jobs than they destroy but warns of pandemic ‘double-disruption’

summary: Snap Chief Business Officer Jeremi Gorman said that brand advertising is showing momentum, and that advertisers want a platform that shares their values.
headline: Snap says brand advertising coming back, hints that Facebook boycott helped Q3

summary: Check out the companies making headlines in after hours trading on Tuesday.
headline: Stocks making the biggest moves after hours: Netflix, Snap, Texas Instruments & more
California sets 'unworkable' requirements for theme park reopenings, Disney says
summary: Officials in California, home to Walt Disney's Disneyland, said on Tuesday that large theme parks cannot reopen until a county's Covid-19 risk level drops to the lowest tier of "minimal" spread.

headline: Netflix loses the battle, but it's still on target to win Wall Street's war
summary: Netflix shares fell after reporting fewer subscribers than forecast, but the company's main investment thesis remains in tact.
Investor Mario Gabelli struck a positive note on Tuesday on the U.S. economy even as coronavirus cases in the country are on the rise.
headline: Mario Gabelli sees 'extraordinarily good' U.S. economic growth in 2021
